Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Personnel \Per`son`nel"\, n. [F. See {Personal}.] The body of persons employed in some public service, as the army, navy, etc.; -- distinguished from mat['e]riel. [1913 Webster]

personnel n 1: group of people willing to obey orders; "a public force is necessary to give security to the rights of citizens" [syn: {force}] 2: the department responsible for hiring and training and placing employees and for seting policies for personnel management [syn: {personnel department}, {personnel office}, {staff office}]
